Azure SQL Data Warehouse is a data columnar storage service that is elastic, scalable, fully entrusted and extendable to one trillion bytes. It is completely compatible and integrated with SQL Server ecological system. This is the first cloud data warehouse that allows users to expand or shrink calculating capacity within seconds, which is absolutely exclusive in the industry. SQL Data Warehouse can independently extend or shrink storage and computing capacity, enabling users to pay for querying performance only when needed.

Pricing Details

Computing and storage are independently charged. Since the usage about computing capacity is displayed in DWU (Data Warehouse Units), the customer can expand or shrink performance as needed through DWU. When data warehouse is not used, computing can be paused so as to save on costs.

*The following prices are tax-inclusive.

*Monthly pricing estimates are based on 744 hours of usage per month.

Storage

Data Storage and Snapshots

Data storage is charged at Azure Premium Storage rates of ￥ 906.29/TB/month (￥ 1.22/TB/hour). The data storage service includes data warehouse storage and 7 days of incremental snapshot storage.

Note: Storage transactions are free of charge. In other words, you only need to pay for the data storage service, and no transaction fees are needed.

Geo-Redundant Disaster Recovery

Your data warehouse is copied to Geo-Redundant Storage for disaster recovery. Storage of Geo-Redundant copies will be charged according to the rate for Azure Storage Standard Disk RA-GRS, that is, ￥ 1.056/GB/month.

FAQ

Expand All
  • What is a DWU (Data Warehouse Unit)?

    The Data Warehouse Unit (DWU) has been introduced into SQL Data Warehouse to offer customers a more predictable performance experience. DWU represents potent query performance and is quantified through workload objectives: how fast you can scan, load, and copy rows. This metric helps customers assess the relative performance required by their SQL Data Warehouse.

  • How is SQL Data Warehouse usage reflected in my bill?

    Your bill will be composed of a predictable monthly storage fee and a changeable computing fee. The computing fee may vary from month to month, depending on the amount of used computing resources and duration (DWU). Storage and computing are two separate items on the bill so that you can easily figure out the level of computing resources used.

  • What if the duration of my DWU usage is less than one hour?

    As long as your database is active (not paused), DWU is charged by the hour. If the activity time of DWU is less than one hour, the bill will reflect the fee for a whole hour. If the database is stopped for one hour, no fees will be charged for that period of time.

  • What if I use DWUs of different levels within one hour?

    DWU will be charged by the hour based on the unit pricing of the highest-grade performance used within the hour.

  • What is the pause feature?

    SQL Data Warehouse offers the unique ability to pause and resume computing needs. If a team does not use a data warehouse instance for a period of time—such as during the night, over a weekend, or holiday, or for another reason—you can pause the data warehouse instance and then choose the place you left off when you return. Note: Since storage is separate, your storage is not suspended. For information on pausing, please see the documentation.

  • Can I use a regular Azure Storage account together with SQL Data Warehouse?

    If you have regular Azure storage account (Web Blob or Block Blob), you should just import it into SQL Data Warehouse by using Polybase. Supported file layouts include texts with separators, Hive RCFile or Hive ORC.

=======

Azure SQL Data Warehouse can quickly implement a high-performance, globally available, and secure cloud data warehouse. Users can independently scale compute and storage, while pausing and resuming data warehouse within minutes through a massively parallel processing system designed for the cloud. Create analytics hub and native connectivity with data integration and visualization services using existing SQL and BI skills.

SQL Data Warehouse provides 99.9% availability guarantee, regulatory compliance, built-in advanced security functions and data sovereignty across more than 30 regions, to allow users to create a data warehouse that suits business needs. SQL Data Warehouse uses intelligent caching to accelerate data access and query performance to handle the most demanding data warehouse workload. Azure SQL Data Warehouse can be used in 2 compute optimized SKUs: Gen1 and Gen2.

Pricing Details

  • Compute optimized Gen2
  • Compute optimized Gen1

Includes adaptive caching, which provides enhanced performance for workloads with consistent compute requirements. Tailored for intensive workloads with higher query performance and compute scalability needs.

Storage

Storage pricing below reflects the pricing of official offering.

Data Storage and Snapshots

Data storage service is charged at the rate of Azure Premium Storage i.e. ¥ 906.29/1TB/month (¥ 1.22/1TB/hour). Data storage service covers data warehouse storage and 7 days of incremental snapshot storage.

Note: Storage transactions are free of charge. In other words, you only need to pay for the data storage service, and no transaction fees are needed.

Geo-Redundant Disaster Recovery

Your data warehouse is copied to Geo-Redundant Storage for disaster recovery. Storage of Geo-Redundant copies will be charged according to the rate for Azure Storage Standard Disk RA-GRS, that is, ￥ 1.056/GB/month.

FAQ

Expand All
  • Will I be billed immediately upon creating data warehouse?

    Yes. You will be billed hourly on compute and storage once the data warehouse is created. Compute is billed at ￥ 5,989.2/100 DWU/month unless you pause the data warehouse. Storage is billed at ￥906.29/1 TB/month.

  • What other contents will I be charged when I pause the data warehouse?

    Pausing the data warehouse will pause the compute. If the data warehouse is paused for one hour, you will not be charged for that hour. If the data warehouse was active and paused again within the hour, you will be charged for that hour of compute. When you pause the data warehouse, you will be charged for the storage that includes data warehouse documents, 7-day incremental backups and the data warehouse documents, and copies of remote redundancy (if you opted in). For more details, please refer to documentation.

  • How are compute and data storage billed?

    Compute and storage are billed separately, to provide you greater ease in understanding all the levels of compute resources. The use of compute is billed on an hourly basis. For example, if the data warehouse is active for 12 hours in a month, you will be billed for the 12 hours the data warehouse existed. If the data warehouse is active for only 30 minutes in 1 month, you will be billed for 1 hour.

  • How is data storage billed?

    The data storage charge is inclusive of the size of the primary database and 7 days of incremental snapshots. All charges are rounded to the nearest TB. For example, if the data warehouse is 1.5TB and you have 100GB of snapshots, you will be billed 2TB of data at the rate of ￥906.29/1 TB/month.

  • What should I do if I need more than 1 TB of storage?

    Storage is sold in 1 TB allocations. If storage exceeds 1 TB, the storage account will automatically increase to 2 TB.

  • Can I opt out of snapshots?

    You cannot opt out of snapshots, because this capability can protect your data warehouse in the event of data loss or corruption.

  • How would my storage be billed for opt in to geo redundant disaster recovery?

    Your data warehouse can be copied to Geo-Redundant Storage for disaster recovery. Storage of Geo-Redundant copies will be charged according to the rate for Azure Storage Standard Disk RA-GRS, that is, ￥ 1.056/GB/month.

Support & SLA

If you have any questions or need help, please visit Azure Support and select self-service or any other method to contact us for support.

We promise that client-side operations performed in the SQL Data Warehouse will be successful at least 99.9% of the time. For more details about our Service Level Agreement, please visit the Service Level Agreements page.
